title: Understanding Bipolar II Disorder
text: Bipolar II disorder is different from Bipolar I disorder in terms of the severity of manic episodes. Consider what type of episodes are present in Bipolar II.

title: Characteristics of Bipolar II
text: Bipolar II disorder involves episodes that are less severe than full-blown manic episodes. What are these less severe episodes called?

title: Identifying Episodes in Bipolar II
text: What type of episodes are present in Bipolar II disorder that are not as severe as those in Bipolar I?

hintAnswer: a pattern of depressive and hypomanic episodes but not the $$full-blown$$ manic episodes observed in bipolar I disorder
title: Comparing Bipolar I and II
text: Bipolar I disorder includes full-blown manic episodes. What type of episodes does Bipolar II disorder include instead?
choices: manic episodes that last for at least seven days or by manic symptoms so severe that hospitalization is required, and usually includes depressive episodes as well
a pattern of depressive and hypomanic episodes but not the $$full-blown$$ manic episodes observed in bipolar I disorder
